results.title: Another day, another dollar: three short films about the history of work
results.brief_description:
“Projected memories: work in old films”: In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.
“Never done: women, work and history”: Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.
“Close to slavery: black work in white history”: It was government policy for Aboriginal Australians to assimilate to the white ethics of education and work whereas traditional Aborigines did not recognise the western idea of work and preferred to follow their own cultural identity. Then came the mission stations, removal of Aboriginal children, forced labour often in the most deplorable conditions, exploitation and even when black Australians were trained in skilled work through the mission stations, white Australians would not employ them - all this most comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film.

results.title: Animated geometry: the angle at the circumference
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
Related to the basic theorem concerning the angle at the circumference. Two cases are studied, that of the angle having a diameter at one side and that angel including the centre between its sides. Series is: Animated geometry.

results.title: Subtended arc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”
Two straight lines intersecting at a fixed angle are made to slide on the extremities of a fixed straight line; the point of intersection traces out a complete circle.

results.title: A Circle is determined by three points
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
The three degrees of freedom of a circle - the radius and the co-ordinates of the centre - are reduced stage by stage until finally three points are given. Animated diagrams.

results.title: Architype
results.creator_credit: Henry Lutman, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
This brilliant short animation directed and animated by Henry Lutman uses a real conversation recording to portray two architects discussing a plan to build a new shopping mall. While the characters flick through large technical drafts of the mall a homeless man walks across the pages to reveal the social consequences of redevelopment and to show the viewer between the lines of the real conversation. The film outstandingly shows a multiplex of possible realities- the real conversation recording - the animated architects and a homeless man minimally draw into the stark architectural line drawings. The animated characters begin to seem more realistic than the real conversation recording the film is based on. This title is part of a series of animated films made by the BBC called Animated Conversations.
